website_summaries.verdict: These smooth little soups are an excellent lickable cat treat due to their quality meat sources and sizable portion cups.
pros: Creamy broth with real chunks of chicken and shrimp
Comes in a set of eight cups

customer_reviews.title: Poor package design
customer_reviews.text: My cats LOVE these. Unfortunately, the package design is a terrible choice. Most pet gravies come in foil pouches. These are little plastic bowls with foil lid. The first time I opened one, at least half of it spilled onto my clothes. I've learned to be extremely careful about keeping the package flat on a counter while sloooowly pulling back the foil then sloooowly moving the bowl to the floor.
customer_reviews.author: LeendaDLL

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for older cats
customer_reviews.text: I have an older adult cat that has lost a few teeth and has trouble eating dry food so a few years ago we started feeding him some canned food. We received a free sample from friskies and he went ape for it. The next week we ordered 3 flavors and he has lots more energy and loves it. They are kinda expensive a a buck a piece but my lil buddy is worth it. It will give him a better quality of life in his sunset years.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: ICE CREAM to a cat
customer_reviews.text: My cats are VERY picky when it comes to their food. All stews and soups I have tried, even the expensive ones. I was wary about buying this due to another waste of money, and donating more unwanted cat food to neighbors, etc. When I break one of these open they perk up immediately and lick the bowl clean at a fast pace. They then lick their jaws and paws for an extensive period of time. They love all the varieties. I now not only have their meals picked out to a 'T', I have their favorite mid-time snack & appetizers, and now their dessert...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lil soups
customer_reviews.text: My picky ginger tabby Gargamel really likes these 'Lil soups' by Friskies, and I love that they are almost all liquid with very little solids. He usually eats Fancy Feast with gravy, but he only eats the gravy and leaves the solid bits behind. These soups are perfect for him because now I don't have to run these solid bits down my garbage disposal. Plus the plastic trays are safe enough for him to eat directly out of the container, unlike the metal cans which have to be emptied onto a plate or bowl. Overall these end up saving me time, mess and hassle - and they are a hit with my cat.
customer_reviews.author: C. A. Boswell

customer_reviews.title: Kitty Cat loves
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves these lil soups. Its so easy to give him his meal- just shake, open and set down. Its the perfect amount for my 1yr old cat.
customer_reviews.author: Danielleshu

customer_reviews.title: My cats love these.
customer_reviews.text: My cats love the gravy but always leave the pieces of protein. Maybe you could cut it up in smaller pieces. The price is very high for the size of the package.
customer_reviews.author: ginger

customer_reviews.title: Picky Eater Loved It
customer_reviews.text: My cat does not like the more solid wet foods, or chunks. He only likes broths and soups. He doesn’t even eat the small pieces of meat left over in the soups. A very picky eater! He seems to enjoy these soups a lot! And they were a nice sized serving too. The only reason I gave it only four stars is because he puked a few times during the time frame of trying these out. I can’t say for sure that it was related to the soups, but I’m trying something else for now just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Soup for my cat
customer_reviews.text: I tell you, my cat loves this soup so much that she eats less her dry food. I try to give her one a day, but she wants more.
customer_reviews.author: Ms Isabel

customer_reviews.title: Cat Adores These
customer_reviews.text: My cat had oral surgery to remove his infected teeth. Of course, he now has to eat mushy food. I was having a problem getting him to try canned food (I think because before the surgery, he loved his dry kibble and rarely ate wet food) until I gave him one of these. It was darned near a miracle! He lapped it up and begged for more! They are pricey considering the amount of food in the container, but worth the price if you're searching for something your cat will like. I poured a container of Lil Soups over a mixture of pate and water for my cat this evening, and he ate it all. Yay!
customer_reviews.author: K S

customer_reviews.title: *** Cat's Meow ! ***
customer_reviews.text: AAA+ For me, I have two cats and they get one each as a dinner treat, they go nuts and meow and cry when they see the container and follow me around till I set them down, they eat/drink ever drop, They absolutely LOVE these Lil Soups ___A little expansive , but my cats are like my kids and family, so, why not spoil them
customer_reviews.author: Ed_B

customer_reviews.title: Picky Princesses ❤️❤️❤️It!
customer_reviews.text: I have two beloved but very spoiled senior cats who sniff, pick, and turn their nose up at just about everything. I don’t know what’s in this - it must be kitty crack. I opened it up and the two of them came running over and they licked it down clean. My mouth was hanging open. They love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My kitty loves them!
customer_reviews.text: While I, myself do not have any idea what these soups tastes like, my 16 year old Siamese loves them. She is missing almost all of her teeth, and I am always looking for brothy things to get for her that she enjoys. When you open these little cups, it is pretty easy and the contents do not fly out like a lot of the more liquid type foods tend to do. I give her two a day, and it has not made her gain any extra weight. Also, she has not regurgitated anything since I started using this product- but she has with others- so it seems pretty easy on her tummy.
customer_reviews.author: Pamster19

customer_reviews.title: Cats love them
customer_reviews.text: Purchased initially for an elderly cat with a swallowing disorder. All of my cats love these as a special treat. They even liked the squash flavor. Biggest down side is that they are small and the seal is very tight. I have spilled more than one trying to open the package. Of course, I have ample assistance with clean up though.
customer_reviews.author: Sardra

customer_reviews.title: Good Medium for Medication
customer_reviews.text: Best thing ever to get my ‘mature’ cat to take her medicine. She likes variety and gravy, and Lil Soups has both. Wish it was not so expensive!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My cats love it!
customer_reviews.text: My cats love these either poured over their canned food or poured over their crunchies. They are all finicky eaters but eat the entire portion with this on top, great product
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Jean

customer_reviews.title: Cats love it, but very expensive for broth, and portions are not adequate!
customer_reviews.text: To be honest, the "soup" looks awful!!! However, all three of my kitties LOVED it! Sadly, the "lil" soups are just that..... "little". Too little! I expected much larger bowls for the price....it's just a little liquid and a few shreds of meat, after all! As a snack for one kitty, I had to give him two "bowls", and he really wanted another still. For the price (about $1.60 each!) it is not a good value at all.
customer_reviews.author: C. S. Wilkinson

customer_reviews.title: My kitty likes it.
customer_reviews.text: He is elderly and finicky, but he slurped two of these right down when they arrived today. I'm insisting he eat some dinner before he gets another. They are for snacks only, of course, and they are small... they aren't meant to be a balanced diet. Still, if he's happy, that's good enough for me.
customer_reviews.author: East Coast

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves them!
customer_reviews.text: My 15 year old cat is very picky and loses interest in the same thing after a while. This makes giving him his daily hypertension and hyperthyroidism meds a challenge as i need be 100% certain he receives all of them and doesn't leave anything behind. With these coming in multiple flavors, he doesn't get bored with the same old thing and it's the perfect portion size to put his meds in and in a few minutes he laps it all up a d leaves a clean bowl. He loves them!
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: not her favorite flavor
customer_reviews.text: i appreciate that Friskies is being creative; the fact that it 's not a standard cat food flavor. But, my finicky 17yo just wasn't into it like the other flavors. This is a great product line for her as she's preferring softer, creamier foods the older she gets. Keep trying Friskies, we're always looking for something different she will eat.
customer_reviews.author: John W.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for senior kitties with picky palates
customer_reviews.text: Ridiculously expensive for such a tiny cup of cat broth, but my nearly-19-year-old kitty has become very finicky, and this is one of the few cat foods she still eats. It's mostly a thick creamy broth, but does have a few solid pieces.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ullman

customer_reviews.title: Great for cats with dental issues!
customer_reviews.text: My cat has an autoimmune mouth disorder and has had to have most of his teeth removed since he was 6 months old. So, he could not eat hard food at all. He does now sometimes, but it’s not his mainstay. He loves the lil soups and possibly is addicted to them. Even so, he’s much happier if he has them then if he doesn’t. Maybe he’s spoiled now but I want him to be happy, pain free and as healthy as possible. I recommend this product for any cat that has mouth issues and difficulty eating. They’re also a great treat for any cat. Wish they were bigger!
customer_reviews.author: Cheri

customer_reviews.title: Used to be a FAV, now won’t eat it at all. What changed??
customer_reviews.text: Has the recipe changed? My cat used to LOVE this and beg for the lil soups. It’s all he wanted. The last box I ordered, he won’t touch them. I’ve tried several containers on different days thinking maybe he just wasn’t hungry for it on a particular day but he won’t take one lick of it. They went from his absolute favorite to something he smells and turns his nose up at. I’m really curious if it’s a bad batch or if the recipe has changed.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Review: Senior Formula in Skipjack Tuna
customer_reviews.text: My oldest cat is not eating and is only drinking water so I got this for her. She hasn't partake of it yet but the two younger cats cleaned out the bowl in seconds so I'm saving it as a once-per-week treat. If you buy YoCrunch yogurt, save the cover as it fits so you can store some away without having it spilled or carry the scent over your fridge.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Pringle

customer_reviews.title: It’s a hit
customer_reviews.text: Trying a new cat food or treats is always tricky when you have a finicky eater. This one was a hit. It’s the chicken and butternut squash version. My Bella loves it so much she squeals when she sees me pick up one of the cups.
customer_reviews.author: rziegle

customer_reviews.title: Happy cat. Picky eater.
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is the best. Sometimes it’s hard to find something for cats either because their appetite is low due to illness or they are older or just a picky eater. I was told by my cat that this is the best they have ever eaten. See photo.... (wish it cost less per serving, but it’s a great occasional snack).
customer_reviews.author: Michelle M. Clowser

customer_reviews.title: Lil soups
customer_reviews.text: My picky ginger tabby Gargamel really likes these 'Lil soups' by Friskies, and I love that they are almost all liquid with very little solids. He usually eats Fancy Feast with gravy, but he only eats the gravy and leaves the solid bits behind. These soups are perfect for him because now I don't have to run these solid bits down my garbage disposal. Plus the plastic trays are safe enough for him to eat directly out of the container, unlike the metal cans which have to be emptied onto a plate or bowl. Overall these end up saving me time, mess and hassle - and they are a hit with my cat.
customer_reviews.author: C. A. Boswell

customer_reviews.title: very little quantity, unsure what it is exactly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for one of my cats who does not like canned cat food - only dry food - but needs more moisture in her diet. I have been trying different cat broths with limited success and decided to give this "soup" a try. Each container is quite small with only an ounce or so of a thick-ish creamy liquid. She turned her nose up at this and won't even taste it. My other cat likes it so at least it isn't going to waste. But unless you pour this over other food, it's hardly worth the effort to open and serve it due to the small quantity.
customer_reviews.author: ccsteveTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Cassie Will Eat It
customer_reviews.text: Our 18 year old girl is getting fussy about what she will eat. She wants something every two hours but not a lot. The Lil Soups are just the right amout for a snack. I alternate with regular canned food and she is satisfied. Beware of feeding too much though as it can cause the runs.
customer_reviews.author: G. Chow

customer_reviews.title: My Cat Loves These
customer_reviews.text: My cat will only lick the juice off of food and leave the actual food alone. She really likes these lil soups. I haven't tried the chicken and squash flavor yet. But all three of the other flavors she will eat. They are very small in size. These are pricey for what you get, but if she eats them, we are both happy.
customer_reviews.author: Dar

customer_reviews.title: How did this happen!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I disliked the fact that I received 1 only lil soups!!!! I thought I was supposed to get 8???????
customer_reviews.author: Char berryman

customer_reviews.title: 😽 Cat Approved
customer_reviews.text: My freaking cat loves these and he's funny about his food. He'll only eat the broth or gravy and leaves any chunks of meat of ANY wet food he tries. That being said I try to find him stuff that's mostly broth. This fits the bill and he just gets so excited for it, it's adorable. If he's happy, I'm happy. I'll never stop buying this. 😻
customer_reviews.author: Catattack

customer_reviews.title: My cat LOVES this soup
customer_reviews.text: My cat LOVES this soup. He gets it once a day but he wants it all day.
customer_reviews.author: Jane G

customer_reviews.title: The Captain is now a very happy cat!
customer_reviews.text: I have a very, very picky cat. The Captain will only eat Purebites wet food which is hard to find and a bit expensive. He licks all the sauce in Purebites first and then eats only half of the bigger pieces. The Captain refuses to eat left overs. So the "lil soups" label caught my attention. He loved it! He licked all the gravy first and for the first time, he ate all the bigger pieces too. The sauce is more like a gravy compared to Purebites liquid. Im going to order the other flavors now and hope they are winners too.
customer_reviews.author: christie

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I initially got this for my 3 cats as a treat. They couldn't get enough. Then one of my cats got arthritis. I was able to crush her pills and mix it in without her noticing. Another cat got depressed after I had to put my 3rd cat to sleep. He refused to eat anything but these lil soups. I mixed his meds in and he didn't notice either. I told my vet about it and she loves that meds can be mixed in and cats still gobble it up. These lil soups have made giving meds SO much easier.
customer_reviews.author: mmgood

customer_reviews.title: My cat Loves this stuff!!
customer_reviews.text: My cat is usually a really picky eater, She loves the gravy from canned food, so when I saw this I figured I would give it a shot to see if she liked it. She completely cleans the little bowl Everytime I open one. They even have little pieces of real chicken, shrimp or Salmon in there. I definitely recommend trying them out, especially if you have a picky eater.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Grant

customer_reviews.title: Someone at Friskies deserves an award
customer_reviews.text: I agree 100% with the various comments in the other 5-star reviews--our elderly ladies go nuts over these as a treat. It's a small enough serving so they don't walk away leaving it unfinished. But I mainly want to say that whomever came up with the name is genius! So cuuute! Can't say it with out grinning. And the first time I sent the Mr. out to get more, he came home empty-handed: he couldn't find them on the shelf & was too embarrassed to ask "Do you have those lil soups?" Because the name is TOO silly. To which I say, if they will eat it--and it's healthy--the sillier the better.
customer_reviews.author: CyndyB

customer_reviews.title: My older cat loves it.
customer_reviews.text: I guess I am writing this from my elder cats perspective. She likes it a lot! Easy for her to lap up, and she adores the taste. She eats other foods too, but this is her treat each night.
customer_reviews.author: E. McNamara

customer_reviews.title: SENIOR Recipe!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the only wet food one of my cats will eat. He weirdly will only slurp his wet foods and won’t eat anything where he has to chew. I usually get the variety pack and was excited to see a new flavor for them to try but I didn’t notice it was a senior formula. My picky cat doesn’t seem to prefer this flavor but the one that will eat anything didn’t seem to notice. I won’t buy it again as My cats aren’t seniors and I’m not sure what makes the diet different but I’ll stick with the variety packs where surprisingly neither cat will eat the solid shrimp pieces in the shrimp one.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Browne

customer_reviews.title: My kitty’s favorite snack :)
customer_reviews.text: Kitty loves her soups. I have a pretty finicky eater and she gets one of these each night while I’m cooking dinner, just because she barely eats enough regular food and I hate continually switching to find something she will like better. These are totally worth it and much less expensive here on amazon Than in the stores. I have not seen any issues with freshness or quality, and will continue to buy. FYI my coco kitty loves the shrimp and tuna flavors more than anything else. Salmon is good too but We never tried squash.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer harms

customer_reviews.title: My aging, particular cat will eat them!
customer_reviews.text: My cat is probably on his last legs and has gotten extremely picky. He will go DAYS without eating if we don't intervene. We have to sit down with him, dip our finger in his wet food and have him lick it off. That's the only way he wants to eat most days. These little soups are hardly every turned down. I open one up, he eats it and walks away. I don't have to spend 10 minutes trying to get him to eat. Every cat is different, but the only flavor he likes is chicken and butternut squash. Then again, who doesn't like butternut squash?
customer_reviews.author: Peaches

customer_reviews.title: SICK CAT LOVES IT
customer_reviews.text: My sweet kitty is fading and she had stopped eating even though she kept begging for food. She'd sit and stare at the various options I had for her; Fancy food, junk food, ground kibble, Babycat kibble... nothing. And... SHE LOVES THIS AND EATS THE WHOLE THING. So far, no stomach upset in the litter box! It's a miracle. It has a few little chunks but is mostly creamy liquid. I definitely recommend! You could pour it or mix it in with normal food for picky cats. But it might literally be a life saver for us.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Picky cat loves these
customer_reviews.text: My very strange and picky cat does not like people food, doesn't go near meat, and will only sometimes lick the gravy from a can of wet food that his brother gets. When my other cat gets his much-loved wet food as a treat, my picky cat stares at me with judgey eyes because he doesn't get any, but when I try, he won't touch it. I decided to give the Lil Soups a try hoping it would be gravy-ish enough for him to eat most of it, leaving some for his brother probably. HE EATS ALL OF IT. Even the little bits of meat in it.
customer_reviews.author: Crystaline

customer_reviews.title: Finicky Cat Loves These Soups!
customer_reviews.text: Our Cat has had all his teeth removed but one. He was losing weight so we decided to supplement his diet with these soups. He doesn't eat the "solids" at the bottom but he laps up the soup voraciously. We tried a bunch of different gel foods, and purees, but this was the winner. What he doesn't consume his brother will eat. It is well worth it. He doesn't love all the flavors, so it would be great to have individual flavor boxes, but I am so grateful this product exists.
customer_reviews.author: KitKatsMommy

customer_reviews.title: My cats LOSE THEIR MINDS over this
customer_reviews.text: And they normally hate wet food. I've tried the pate and the shreds and they hate it with a passion. This one, however, has them both running and head butting the containers. They are nearly hysterical in their urgency to GET IT RIGHT NOW. I love the portion size since neither is a huge Eater and the bigger ones go to waste. The container makes clean up a breeze and no need to wash bowls. To me this is worth every penny. They get one of these a day and dry iams urinary control free feed and are healthy and happy!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Christensen

customer_reviews.title: The Tuna flavor was a hit with Piccolina
customer_reviews.text: I think we have the pickiest cat in the world, so buying her food that she will actually eat is somewhat difficult, especially trying to give her a little variety. We bought this one because our cat prefers wet food that has a bisque/gravy consistency. We purchased the variety pack, and while she was not a fan of the salmon flavor, surprisingly, she did eat the tuna flavor and actually seemed to enjoy it. Next time I wont order the variety pack, I'll just order the tuna flavor. This time around, the salmon flavor cups went to my mom's outdoor strays once again.
customer_reviews.author: Liv D.

customer_reviews.title: My cat likes it
customer_reviews.text: I have a cat who only likes dry food and broth-type wet food. She won't eat the meat that comes in the broth pouches, so I waste a lot of money on those since they have chunks of meat. The Lil' Soups are mostly "soup" with very little meat, so that works better for my cat. That may not be an endorsement for a cat who will eat the meat, but it gives my cat more liquid. The "soup" is thicker than most broth pouches - even the creamy broths in other brands - more like a chowder broth, but she likes the flavor and will lap up all of it, so I am happy.
customer_reviews.author: ccsteveTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great for soup/gravy loving cats
customer_reviews.text: My picky ginger tabby Gargamel really likes these 'Lil soups' by Friskies, and I love that they are almost all liquid with very little solids. He usually eats Fancy Feast with gravy, but he only eats the gravy and leaves the solid bits behind. These soups are perfect for him because now I don't have to run these solid bits down my garbage disposal. Plus the plastic trays are safe enough for him to eat directly out of the container, unlike the metal cans which have to be emptied onto a plate or bowl. Overall these end up saving me time, mess and hassle - and they are a hit with my cat.
customer_reviews.author: C. A. Boswell

customer_reviews.title: Not sure, but perhaps they spoil easily....
customer_reviews.text: There is not a lot per tub, and it's only appropriate as a treat, not a meal. Regardless, my Cat loves this and I am happy to provide him with it. However, at least two shipments (3 boxes each) were not up to snuff. He would not eat it, and I believe there was something wrong with the batch that was shipped. I ended up disposing of them and purchased some locally, which he promptly devoured. I am not certain, but perhaps the broth spoils too easily, since the batch's expiration date was at least a year in advance. This is one item that I will no longer purchase on line.
customer_reviews.author: Artemis

customer_reviews.title: Lil'Soups for cats
customer_reviews.text: cat loves it, portions are a bit small but there are no leftovers. My Cat is old and this is easy for her to gobble down. Very pleased overall esp as she eats it all. No leftovers
customer_reviews.author: Nadine Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Kitty Loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I have a very old kitty who has lost most of her teeth and has a hard time eating dry food. I give her 1 of these every afternoon to supplement her diet. She loves them and empties the container every time!
customer_reviews.author: Karma Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Lil Bowls of Heaven, but Pricey
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 cats, a 13yo and 2 1yo brothers. My cats absolutely love these lil bowls of heaven. My only complaint is they are very pricey for 3 cats. I use 2 cups each day divided between the 3, mixed with some fancy feast gravy lovers beef cans. I have them on subscribe and save, but they are still pricey. However, because my cats love these so much I managed it in my budget, because as all hoomans of cats know, we serve at their pleasure. My only suggestion is, if you really can't fit these in your budget, don't let your cats try it, because there's no going back.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Spring

customer_reviews.title: Your cat will LOVE these
customer_reviews.text: Oh my! I’ve created a kitty monster by giving her these lil soups. My cat doesn’t eat enough and can get dehydrated easily bc we live in the desert. She absolutely loves these lil soups by Friskies. I tried 4-5 other similar products made by other brands, but she doesn’t like them. I even tried making chicken “cat soup” but she wouldn’t eat it. Every morning, she goes nuts until we get the lid off her lil soups! She favorite flavors are the shrimp and chicken.
customer_reviews.author: Jpenman

customer_reviews.title: Should probably be illegal
customer_reviews.text: I'll be honest, it's expensive but my cat is hooked. I'm ordering it again, against the gripes of the family and friends who say I'm just enabling him, but look, he's been living outside under porch for years already - maybe I owe the little guy after all. This is the first cat food I'm honestly considering giving a try myself. If you see me on the news stealing copper from old houses then you know its likely the cat food that did it.
customer_reviews.author: DJT

customer_reviews.title: My cat LOVES them!
customer_reviews.text: I have to give my 12 year old cat prescription medicine daily and it was becoming a pain because she wasn’t the easiest to give a pill to. I was crushing up her pill and placing it various soft treats and can foods that she loves and she would take one bite/sniff and walk away. So one day I grabbed one of these while out at the store. I came home, crushed up her pill into powder and mixed it in with the soup. She loved it! Ate every single morsel. It’s been weeks and she still loves them. Licks them completely dry. As long as she eats them, I’ll never buy anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Brittney E

customer_reviews.title: HERSELF MUST HAVE
customer_reviews.text: When I took in Rescue Cat Noel (The First) she was on quarantine and scared after being a feral cat and the victim of a savage animal attack. She settled in and did fine with water and dry food but she was not at all interested in ANY wet food or treat - until I found these - I open one , dump in the bowl and mix with a bit of warm water - put the bowl down and the next thing you hear is a motorboat engine of licking - a good choice for a picky cat - note - although they have SOME varieties in stores you will get more choice online.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Mcceney

customer_reviews.title: Helped get my cat's weight back up after extractions
customer_reviews.text: My cat recently got 7 teeth removed and was on a wet-food only diet for a month. I had a really tough time getting her to eat wet food and she was beginning to lose weight. These Lil Soups saved the day. She wouldn't touch any other wet food that I tried, but she would devour these. I wouldn't recommend them for the long term because they aren't nutritious enough, but they work great if you just need to get some calories in your cat. If you're in a similar situation, another lifesaver is chicken and gravy baby food (be sure it's just meat and water, no onion/garlic).
customer_reviews.author: theofficeflan

customer_reviews.title: My cat is hooked on lil soups.
customer_reviews.text: It must taste really good because my cat keeps asking for these.. Whenever I try to feed him anything else, he doesn't want to eat and goes over and paws at the little box of the lil soups.. It tells me that he wants more of but they don't have the same nutritional value as regular cat food, which I still want him to eat. It's really hard to get him to eat any of his other food now that I've given him lil soups. The only flavor he truly dislikes is the chicken one. Sometimes he gets tired of certain flavors so I just switch and he's happy again.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanninej9

customer_reviews.title: Cat Crack? Do they make a people version?
customer_reviews.text: Old, picky cat laps these up with gusto — every flavor! No mess, easy to open “serving dish”. My 17- year-old cat had gotten very picky about eating and the less she ate, the less appetite she had. I tried Fancy Feast Broths with 50/50 success—she’d eat some of the liquid but never the bits of meat or fish. She LOVES the Friskies Lil’ Soups — all flavors—and licks up every bit and drop. The soups have stimulated her appetite and she’s back to her regular food — but getting the soup of the day too.
customer_reviews.author: GardenGoddess

customer_reviews.title: Cats like it. Way overpriced.
customer_reviews.text: Cats can't have regular soup because it has salt and they can't tolerate salt (it's toxic) but for $30 + shipping you get about two cans of soup worth. If you have one cat and it lasts them a month that might seem reasonable but if you have six like me it's going to be gone fast and the portions are snack size, maybe 2 fluid ounces, and in no way a meal replacement. If I could find this in stores for $15 or less I would probably buy and be happy but for $30 it's too expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: 2 year old kitty LOVES this!
customer_reviews.text: First - I pretty much only leave reviews for items that are extremely great or extremely awful. My 2 year old kitty is typically a pretty picky eater, and he absolutely LOVES these little soup things! Like he rarely eats an entire can of wet food, but he’ll eat one of these soups almost immediately, and he’ll basically beg us to open it faster once he sees that we’re about to give him one of these. the portions are somewhat small, so i wish that was a little bigger. But otherwise, this product is worth it!! I’m not even half way through my first set of this stuff and i already ordered my second one.
customer_reviews.author: amazoncustomer

customer_reviews.title: Taste
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my 15 yr old girl . Shes a Maine coon and is loving it. The size is the right portion and you can't beat the price also. I have tried all the flavors she's lovin all of them. You can put this on dry food also which is great also. Thanks so much for having this product, lots of stores do not carry this or out of stock. Definitely will getting more for my sweet girl🐱
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My cat goes Nuts for them!!
customer_reviews.text: My cat is super picky about what she likes. She goes absolutely nuts over all the flavors of these Lil Soups. We ask her if she wants Fish Fish, she runs to us. We tried all different kinds of can food, but she would lick a little bit of the juice and go. She eats the whole cup of these. She runs around happy afterwards too.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Grant

customer_reviews.title: Happy cat&HAPPY buyer as Amazons $ lowest I've found.
customer_reviews.text: My spumky mouthy feline friend of 22 years likes the lil soups as an occasional treat. Sometimes she will look at it and walk away but if I show her again she'll lap it up. It helps with her weight. At any age cats must maintain their hydration along with a healthy weight.. Again at 22 yrs young its more of a necessity. I do not serve these every day.. Buy note that the packaging states no more than 1 a day
customer_reviews.author: N.A.S

customer_reviews.title: Purina Friskies Lil' Soups.
customer_reviews.text: I have spent a fortune in Fancy Feast Gravy Lovers cat food. My cat would lap up the soupy part and leave the rest. A big waste for sure. Am I ever glad I tried Purina Friskies Lil' Soups. My cat slurps up every drop! No more waste plus the soups are perfectly packaged in one serving containers. No mess. so very nice. Much less expensive than Fancy Feast and a very happy cat! She loves all flavors. Thanks Friskies Lil' Soups!
customer_reviews.author: Peaches and Me

customer_reviews.title: My cats favorite food!!!!  Great for pickier eaters
customer_reviews.text: I have three Persian cats and they pretty much just lick the gravy off of food instead of eating the food. This is worked out really well because it’s almost all liquid. I like that it’s not gelatinous I feel like it’s actually nutritious. Also when you open them the cat food does not squirt out or get on you. This is a plus as many cat foods tend to get on my hand when I open them. Smell actually isn’t bad either.
customer_reviews.author: Barbie B

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this as a way of getting more liquids into my cats. But this product made all of my cats vomit. It was not a fluke either. I have 5 cats and I used this at separate times for different cat. And each one threw up after eating this. I don’t think there was anything wrong with the packaging so I know they were not open or spoiled. Just be aware your cat may vomit after eating this.
customer_reviews.author: JSBauter

customer_reviews.title: Purrrfection.  >^..^<
customer_reviews.text: These really are like giving your cat a bowl of soup with little bits of chicken. They are perfect for a treat and/or a light 2nd meal, so it's purrrfect for cutting down if you have a cat who has been eating too much. I feed my older cat every morning but in the evening she gets one of these.. . And loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Cinda

customer_reviews.title: Good For Older Cats
customer_reviews.text: My cat is 15 years old and slightly fussy. We give her one of these a day, and she really likes them.
customer_reviews.author: C. Hayes

customer_reviews.title: a great item Friskies Lil' Soups and Lil' Grillers Cat Complements
customer_reviews.text: arrived on time in a sturdy package. Unable to find locally and most people are hoarding pet food, you know, help they neighbor types. The product is great. The cat finished it all and voiced his opinion for a second serving. Great product, delivered on type, fresh, in perfect condition.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Appledorf

customer_reviews.title: Squiggy gives it 4 PAWS UP!!
customer_reviews.text: My 16 year old Squiggy has had recent dental issues and also had a few teeth extracted. He was rather reluctant to eat his regular dry food. My daughter recommend Lil Soups as a good alternative. Squiggy loves this stuff, also put in with regular food.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl B.

customer_reviews.title: Just what my cat needed
customer_reviews.text: I had tried every wet cat food that I could get for my cat that has a tumor in his mouth. I would have to chase him around the house for almost an hour to get him to at least lick a little bit of the juice in the wet food. Now both my life and his have completely changed. He's back to meowing begging for food and there is no more chasing him around for an hour. He licks it up quickly and even asks for more which I'm willing to do to help him gain weight even though I can't do anything about his tumor.
customer_reviews.author: Ingrid Lee

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves these!
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves these soups. I wish the portion was a little bigger, she licks and licks but it's not quite enough! They do say 'lil' soups, they are indeed a small portion. Chicken flavor seems to be her favorite but she likes the other flavors as well. A great treat for miss kitty!
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: two paws up!
customer_reviews.text: I saw an adorable video online of a cat enjoying a lil soup every day and I wanted my kitties to experience it. Unfortunately my package didn’t arrive from Amazon (I did receive a refund though so no worries). I took it upon myself to go out to the store and purchase a sleeve of lil’ soups. My brown tabby wasn’t a huge fan- more of a pâté guy. My orange tabby loves them!! I let him lick the lid off then dig in. I’ll be ordering some more, hopefully they don’t get lost in transit lol but overall a tasty treat for my kitty!
customer_reviews.author: Iris Augustadt

customer_reviews.title: She wouldn't even try it.
customer_reviews.text: Wrinkled her nose and walked away! She loves the juice in the Fancy Feast foods. I was hoping this would be like it. But, not even close!
customer_reviews.author: doodlebug

customer_reviews.title: Very nice treat for my kitty
customer_reviews.text: My 9 year old cast likes the gravy in wet food more than the meat, so I have tried many of these types of treats and food packs. There have been many that he walks away from, but he loves these! It is a perfect portion. I just wish they were easier to open, the first one ended up spilled because I was pulling the top too hard :) Lesson learned. I always keep some of these around to treat or bribe my cat with.
customer_reviews.author: Ezra T

customer_reviews.title: Cats Love It
customer_reviews.text: These are great. My cats just want gravy, not meat, so I was happy to find these. The picture on the front is a good representation of what you get - all soup (gravy) and a few bits of meat. For anyone whose cat wants gravy, these are a must. My cats go crazy for these and they devour a single serving in seconds, so it's clearly cat approved. I do wish the price was a little better, but since the cats like they so much, I can overlook it.
customer_reviews.author: BrookeO

customer_reviews.title: My finicky baby girl totally loved these!!
customer_reviews.text: Our cat needed more hydration in her diet since she’s a very finicky middle aged cat and I was unsure if she would like these. Woe did she ever!! Omg. Definitely get these if you want to add some more hydration or sneak liquid or powdered meds into your cats food!! They’re also good if you want to entice a cat to eat their dry food if you are transitioning foods Definitely will be buying more!!
customer_reviews.author: DRL

customer_reviews.title: I think my batch spoiled
customer_reviews.text: I give one daily to my cat. I usually buy at Walmart but they have been out. This last batch I bought must have got to hot in shipping and made my cat throw up. When I recieved this I immediately put under counter where I always keep it. I stopped giving it to her and she stopped throwing up. Im sorry about the bad news. I love the product and I call them lick licks. I'll have to buy the next batch at Walmart. Thank you, but I am stuck with a bunch of lick licks. Sincerely Martha Arnold
customer_reviews.author: Martha Arnold

customer_reviews.title: One of my two cats LOVES these!
customer_reviews.text: I've got two cats and they are both very picky eaters. One of them, well, he still won't touch this more than a few licks. But the other? She loves them! I tried to get both of them to eat wet food before to get a little more liquid into their diets, and noticed that the one cat would lick the liquid off the wet food but not eat the solids. The soupiness definitely appeals to her. I do find a few tiny chunks at the bottom that she won't eat, but she devours pretty much the whole thing.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Lautenschlager

customer_reviews.title: My mother has the pickiest cat!
customer_reviews.text: My mom was going through so many varieties of cat food because her cat would eat a few bites and waste the rest, but want something more. The cat can't eat dry food, hates pate, and was wasting so much of the other foods until I found out about these from a client (I pet sit). I now have these on a regular shipment to my mom!
customer_reviews.author: Suzi Wilt

customer_reviews.title: Not a once a day feed and too expensive for more than that.
customer_reviews.text: Cat loves it. I’d give it a 5 on flavor, based on cat reaction, but that’s less than heresay, so I can’t rate that. Seems a bit spendy. Portions are small. I mix it with cat’s usual canned food. And that sort of defeats the purpose. Probably won’t buy again just due to expense. If you value your cat so much that price isn’t an issue, and they don’t eat much, this is good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Beagle Scout

customer_reviews.title: She loves Lil'Soups Senior Flavor
customer_reviews.text: Prissy the Poot loves this Lil'Soups cat food. She is one fat cat so the Senior Tuna flavor is perfect. Lil'Soups is a special treat for her. She licks up all the gravy/soup immediately.
customer_reviews.author: ARTHUR F. KNEALE,JR.

customer_reviews.title: Old cat loves these.
customer_reviews.text: My 19 year old cat loves these, 3 a day and it helps to keep weight on him as he is gotten older. I shake them first before opening, he hears me do that and he is waiting at his dish.
customer_reviews.author: L. Paden

customer_reviews.title: It all depends on your cat...
customer_reviews.text: My 19 y/o cat is hard to please and I have a hard time finding foods she will eat. I have to rotate brands and flavors a lot to keep her interested and eating well. That being said, my Goldie ate the first pouch and turned her nose up at all others after that. They did seem to be very meaty and good sized portions. I can at least say that the cats at my local animal shelter loved all of them!
customer_reviews.author: Shelley

customer_reviews.title: Tasty per my 5 cats!
customer_reviews.text: Cats loved it but the cost is a bit high. Not a fan of plastic containers because of environment. Since I have 5 cats, it would be nice to by the cat soup in soup size cans so there would be more earth friendly since aluminum is easier to recycle than plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen N. Swearingen

customer_reviews.title: My cats love this food - my wallet not so much
customer_reviews.text: My finicky little babies both loved this cat food. I gave them each their own little (and I do mean little) cups and they just inhaled them away. I do believe I will alternate this selection with their normal food. A special occasion dinner from time to time. Unless of course they go out and get jobs and then can have them every day.
customer_reviews.author: Linda D.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: My cats would not eat these little soups
customer_reviews.text: I was so hopeful my cats would love these little pods because they are big gravy fans. But I put one in front of each cat, they sniffed it, and walked away. On the other hand, they love the Friskies Gravy Pouches and can't get enough of those. Friskies, can you make extra gravy for cats in the little pods? My cats would go nuts for a product like that.
customer_reviews.author: BluePeter

customer_reviews.title: Expensive cat soup for the spoiled pet in your life
customer_reviews.text: These soups are the only wet food my ridiculously spoiled cat will only eat. We've tried everything and he only wants the gravy/broth - no chunks of 'meat.' I assume the taste is good because it only takes him a few seconds to lick the bowl clean. I find them to be expensive for the small amount of food in the bowl. I am searching for a less expensive option.
customer_reviews.author: Erica Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Chips loves this !
customer_reviews.text: 1st-I like how I’m rating the flavor- my cat loves them Chips is my cat if you haven’t figured out. A coworker told me about these because her cats go crazy. Legit when I gave it to my cat, she went nuts. I go near the cabinet where they are stored and she meows like crazy. She does better with these soups than with her wet food.
customer_reviews.author: Thae

customer_reviews.title: Velcro LOVES these treats
customer_reviews.text: I have a 22 year old cat which I received as a 49th birthday present! And yes, we have grown old together.. I give these to her as an in between snack/treat and she gobbles them down! In fact, as I am opening each one, she is trying to grab them with her paws!! Sorry that I cannot include a video, but too difficult to open her snack and video at the same time!
customer_reviews.author: Nana

customer_reviews.title: My cat did not appreciate this soup
customer_reviews.text: My cat ate all of the first portion of this soup (perhaps, out of her curiosity? - see next). The next time (in a couple of days) she only ate a half leaving all solid pieces of fish untouched. Now she does not eat even a half, just licks the liquid a bit and that is all she does. All in all, my cat did not appreciate this soup :-(!
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: I only buy it for one reason.....
customer_reviews.text: One of my cats takes a supplement every day. I open the capsules and mix them in this liquid and she gobbles it up. She loves all 3 fish flavors which are all made of the same ingredients, with the exception of the tiny few pieces of fish. This product is ridiculously expensive for what you get, and I would not keep buying except for this reason.
customer_reviews.author: soozinpa

customer_reviews.title: Good For Picky Eating Cat
customer_reviews.text: My cat is the pickiest eater and also has a sensitive stomach. He loves these. He strangely enough loves the squash soup the most, but will gobble it up. Strongly encourage any cat owner whose cat has a preference for brothy/bisque type wet food.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Powell

customer_reviews.title: Leaking
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Willow, but I won't be giving it to her. When I opened the box, I found that something had leaked. I can't tell where the leak came from, so I don't know if this has been contaminated or not. I won't bother to return it. It didn't cost much and it's too much trouble to send it back. I was disappointed that I can't give it to her, but I just can't take the chance that it might make her sick.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Nashland Warren

customer_reviews.title: Great Treat for Older Cat
customer_reviews.text: My elderly cat has terminal cancer, so of course I'm spoiling her rotten until the very end. These little cat soups have become one of her favorite things in the universe. It's super soft so it's easy for her to eat, and it's got enough calories to keep her going. I'm so happy to have found something she likes so much to give her some pleasure before she goes.
customer_reviews.author: A. Grishman

customer_reviews.title: Great for my old cat!
customer_reviews.text: My 13 year old cat is so finicky and has a hard time with crunchy treats, so I bought these as a replacement for 'treats'. He gets one (sometimes two) a day and he eats them up. He does not eat the few chunky pieces that are in them, but he does lap up all of the 'soup'. They are really small, but I knew that when ordering, so not disappointed as I only use them as a treat for him, not a meal.
customer_reviews.author: blondehoudini

customer_reviews.title: Cat is Obsessed but Price is Ridiculous
customer_reviews.text: My car goes nuts when he sees me start to open one. He will stand on his back legs and try to pull my arm down faster. He loves them so much. The only thing I don’t like is the price. Way to expensive for what you get. If they were more reasonably priced I would use twice as many or more but at this price he only gets them a couple times a week at most. Frankly I don’t understand why they are so expensive. Spoiled cat!
customer_reviews.author: James Williams

customer_reviews.title: They like the soup
customer_reviews.text: My 17 year old cat loves the soupy liquid. He isn't much fan of the meat. Usually he likes all the soup up and leaves the scraps behind for the other cats. Portions are small and kind of pricey. These are hard to find also. No stores in my area carry these. Also, don't shake it up before opening the lid or else you'll get soupy cat food splattered all over the place!
customer_reviews.author: waas_sappening

customer_reviews.title: Peak Adorableness Right Here
customer_reviews.text: I’m absolutely in love with these little soups! After seeing someone else post about them and how much their cat enjoyed them, I decided to get a few for my boyfriend and my cats. They absolutely loved them right off the bat! It took a second for them to sniff them but soon after, they absolutely devoured their soups (so enthusiastically all three cats nearly or did knock the cups of the counter haha). Honestly, you can’t beat the price and it’s adorable giving our fur babies yummy soup every once in a while. The only thing I’d like is if the cups were a bit bigger (we have some tubby babies), considering how fast they choked down on ‘em.
customer_reviews.author: Kodi Pye

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny and then some!!!
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny! I came back from camping to find that my sweet girl was very Ill. She can't walk straight and was somewhat dehydrated. I think it is Otis international judging by her symptoms. The emergency clinics are all at capacity these last two days and I have been trying all day to get her in somewhere. Out of desperation to get any kind of fluids in her I ordered these. Sick as she is, she has already lapped up 4 today and even had to potty. Maybe as a treat they are spendy but for us they may be a life saver. Worth their weight in gold if they help my baby!
customer_reviews.author: Ashlie A.

product_meta.title: Purina Friskies Lil' Soups and Lil' Grillers Cat Complements
product_meta.description: Style:Lil' Soups| Color:Shrimp in Chicken Broth| Size:(8) 1.2 oz CupsBring on more playful antics at snack time with your cat when you serve Purina Friskies Lil' Soups With Shrimp in a Velvety Chicken Broth adult wet cat food complement. This mouthwatering recipe features real chicken, shrimp and other high-quality ingredients for a wholesome way to satisfy her cravings between meals. The savory, velvety broth brings added flavor and moisture to every delectable nibble, creating a scrumptious food experience that's sure to keep her happily licking her paws. Intended as a complement to her complete and balanced daily diet, this delightful snack gives you a fun way to treat her to something special. Let your favorite feline know just how much you enjoy spending time with her when you fill her dish with this Purina Friskies Lil' Soups adult wet cat food complement, and feel good about serving her a product backed by a trusted brand. Getting the quality cat food your pet deserves only take a few clicks when you order Purina Friskies from Amazon.com.
feature_bullets: Eight (8) 1.2 Oz. Cup - Purina Friskies Lil' Soups With Shrimp In A Velvety Chicken Broth Adult Wet Cat Food Complement
Packaged In A Convenient Cup For Easy Serving
Savory Broth Rounds Out This Recipe

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
